page.title: 10THE RIVER
page.content:
well with the surrounding countryside.
We measured the flow of the river in the middle where it was quickest. We timed how long it took for a cork to float 10 metres, and recorded three timings. The average time was 2l seconds to travel 10 metres.
We also worked out the size of the stones in the river bed. The middle of the river bed was covered with large stones whose average size was eighty- eight and a half cms. At the edge of the river the stones were very small and averaged seven and a third cms.
